string.value: You don't appear to be in any games right now...
'{0}' comes to the village, talking about some dragons being revived... Join now!
The graybeards voice has been heard! The dragonborn comes! Join {0} if you think that you too, can be a Dragonborn.
Beware, beware, the Dragonborn comes! {0} is about to slay some dragons. Join them using the button!
'{0}' used to be an adventurer like you. But then they took an arrow in the knee. Use the button to avoid more arrows!
Alduin is here! Join {0} in this insanity
Chaotic dragons on the loose! {0} invited you, so Join if you want.
There are people in this world that just want to see things burn. {0} Is one of these people.
The dragonborn comes! {0} wants you to kill them!
This is a chaos game! {0} invited you, so Join if you want.
Who are the dragons? Why are we here? What the hell is the "Dark Brotherhood"? {0} knows, maybe.
You can't join now! The game is already running.
You've already joined!
1 minute left to join
{0} seconds left to join
Not enough players, cancelling game!
Not enough players, the village is too deserted for a game to happen.
Less than 5 people is not enough to stop the dragons.
Less than 5? You're gonna need a bigger party!
I'd start the game if I could, but with less than 5 people, you're making my job harder than it is.
It really is as the legends say. Beware, dragons! The Dragonborn comes. Each one of you will now receive your roles.
I will now tell secretly what your roles are. Be careful and slay all the dragons!
I will send your roles in PM. May the Nine Divines guide us all.
I am currently deciding your fates. Check your PMs.
The most secret of secrets: your roles. They will be sent shortly.
The dragons are loose! Check your PM before they show up.
{0} is banned for attempting an exploit (no names starting with /)
{0}, please change your name to join
Sorry, max player limit has been reached!
{0} has joined the game. {1} players, {2} minimum, {3} max
{0} Please click the start button below or {1} and start me, so I can PM you your role. You may not join the game until you do.
You can't run away! YOU'RE DEAD! Get back in the ground... jeez!
Once upon a time, there was a strong necromancer who could raise the dead. But he passed away long ago. Dead bodies don't walk (at least not in this langfile) so good luck on trying.
{0} has fled in terror!
Look! The coward! {0} has fled!
{0} is too scared to continue!
{0} will not join the fight anymore.
{0} remain.
Hey I didn't ask you anything yet!
You don't seem to be playing...
I can't find a player by that name!
This answer is not valid!
{0} has voted to destroy {1}.
{0} has voted to burn {1}.
{0} has voted to eat {1}.
{0} has voted to hunt down {1}.
{0} claims {1} is a dragon!
{0} claims that {1} stole their food.
{0} used {1}'s forge without permission.
{0} comes out from {1}'s house claiming that there's a strange book inside!
{0} never liked {1} anyways.
{0} was {1}'s Thane, but now just wants them dead.
{0} says we should use {1} as fodder.
{1} has been accused of theft by {0} So {0} wants them dead.
{0} has just been robbed by {1}!
{0} says {1} is a vampire.
{0} stares at {1}, trying to remember their username.
{0} says that {1} is secretly Reanu Keeves, the long lost cousin of Keanu Reeves.
{0} has not voted for 2 nights in a row. The Nine Divines have seen this as a terrible crime, and {0} suddenly falls, dead... {0} is now doomed to wander forever in the planes of Oblivion. {1}
{0} didn't show up to the lynching rally for 2 nights in a row. Since they are clearly a dragon, you all head to {0}'s house to kill them too. After the mob has killed {0}, they discover that {1}

{0} knew that one cannot stay as long as 2 nights away from the town. The town's ruler demanded that {0}'s belongings should be given to their lover, and now there's no place for {0} in this town anymore. {1}
If there's one rule in Skyrim, is this: Don't refrain from voting for 2 nights in a row. This is a crime! {0} paid with their life. {1}
The Elder Scroll proclaimed: DO NOT BE AFK FOR 2 NIGHTS IN A ROW. {0} challenged this rule and is now dead. {1}
No one can escape fate. {0} is (actually, was) a living proof of this. If you don't vote for 2 nights in a row, you WILL DIE. Not seven days, just two are enough. {1}
You traitor!!! You have now turned to the Dragons' side.
Being a human was too boring. Why not become a Dragon now?
The power of the Black Book was too strong. You decided to turn to the dragons side!
Those fool dragons are now dead. You will rule. You will kill them all.
There is no dead dragon. If a dragon is dead, then they are no real dragon. Show them how a true dragon is like!
You were lucky to survive this long. Use this opportunity to win the game as a Dragon now.
The last one remaining. You may have a hard task ahead, being a lone dragon.
The disguise worked, but now is your time to change into a true form. A DRAGON!
Not all humans can become a dragon. You are now a creature with immense power. Crush them!
Choice accepted.
Very well...
Your wish is an order.
I am your sword, and your shield.
As you wish, my Thane.
Lead the way!
I am at your command.
Right behind you.
If you say so.
FOR.... Whiterun?
[laughs in ancient languages]
I will obey.
Will do.
Very well.
I see.
I knew it.
I saw this coming from a long ago.
So it really is how the Elder Scrolls said it would happen.
Of course.
Okay, then.
I'm not so sure about that, but you're the boss.
\nYour walks to the top of the mountain show you that the Greybeard is {0}.
\nThe Greybeard, the sage is {0}.
\nYour friend Greybeard is {0}.
{0} was the Greybeard. As the apprentice, you step up to become the new Greybeard.
{0} was your tutor. Now with {0}'s death, you step up to become the new Greybeard.
After climbing the last steps toward the top of the mountain, you see {0} standing beside {1}'s corpse, preparing them for the funeral. {0}, the apprentice, is now an official Greybeard.
The Voice shows you that {0} is {1}!
The Voice is clear: {0} is {1}!
{0} is CLEARLY {1}!
{0} have a role to play in this battle. It is {1}!
Who do you want to hunt down?
Who do you want to hunt and burn?
Who do you think deserves to die today?
Who will you blame?
Who are you lynching?
Who do you want to investigate?
Choose someone to investigate:
Who's the subject of your current investigation?
While hiding from dragons, you choose to investigate:
Pick someone at random(or not, your call).
Who shall feel the power of your Thu'um? You can shout {0} more time(s).
Make your Voice be heard! You can shout {0} more time(s).
You have {0} more shout(s) before cooldown.
Be bold! You have {0} shout(s) remaining.
You have {0} more shout(s).
Don't forget your FUS RO DAH! You have {0} FUS RO DAH remaining..
To whom will you deliver the next letter?
So many letters, and you've got to deliver them to everyone! Who gets it first?
Time to do your night job. Who gets the next letter?
Run, Forres... *cough* um...\nJust deliver your message.
You have only one message to deliver today. Pick one of the names below to receive it:
You speak with the ancient Voice. Make someone reveal their secrets:
Your Thu'um a whisper... Choose someone to have their true aura revealed.
Roles are no secret when you have The Voice at your side. Choose someone.
You speak with power, and your words will reveal the role of one of them:
One more time, choose someone.
Who do you want to follow?
Who do you want to protect?
Who do you want to guard?
Who do you want to bother?
Where are you going?
Who do you want to kill?
Who do you want to burn?
Who do you want to eat?
Who do you want to kidnap?
Whose blood will feed your powers tonight?
Pick up your silver weapons! Who shall you hunt down tonight?
The night comes, and the vampires get stronger. Who do you suspect?
The vampires are restless. Who's your next target?
So you have someone in mind. Who's the vampire?
There are still vampires out there, you're sure. Pick someone to investigate:
No vampire will stand against you! Hunt one down:
Who is your new mother/father?
Who adopted you?
Who do you want to turn?
Who will become the next vampire?
Your turn. Pick someone to join the vampire ranks:
Who will be the next vampire?
Pick the next vampire:
Make sure you discuss with {0}
You are not alone here. Ask {0} what they think.
and
Dead Dragon(Cursed) -- You are a dead Dragon. You are harmless for now, but if the dragons attack you, you will be revived! Back to the killing =)

Delphine(detective) -- Delphine is the last of the Blades, protectors of the Emperor. During The Great War, you evaded attempts at your life several times, ultimately escaping the Thalmor and being stationed in Cyrodiil. You now returns to Skyrim, remaining alert to the surveillance of the Thalmor. You can research on someone everyday to have their role revealed.

Sam Guevenne(DRUNK) -- You are Sam Guevenne, challenging everyone to your drinking challenges. BUT, this is not who you really are. You are actually the Daedric Lord Sanguine. If the dragons attack you, you will trap them in your dimension, and fight them off. You will end up dying, but at least they will be trapped for the next night.

Lydia(Guardian Angel) -- Your Thane used a cheat code(damn cheaters) to dismiss you from your duties. Now you just help random people. Each night, you will choose someone to protect. If they're someone evil, however, you might end up dying.

Dragonborn(gunner) -- Dovahkiin, Dovahkiin, naal ok zin los vahriin, Wah dein vokul mahfaeraak ahst vaal! Ahrk fin norok paal graan fod nust hon zindro zaan, Dovahkiin, fah hin kogaan mu draal!
 

Huzrah nu, kul do od, wah aan bok lingrah vod, Ahrk fin tey, boziik fun, do fin gein! Wo lost fron wah ney dov, ahrk fin reyliik do jul, Voth aan suleyk wah ronit faal krein
 

Ahrk fin zul, rok drey kod, nau tol morokei frod, Rul lot Taazokaan motaad voth kein! Sahrot Thu'um, med aan tuz, vey zeim hokoron pah, Ol fin Dovahkiin komeyt ok rein!
 

Dovahkiin, Dovahkiin, naal ok zin los vahriin, Wah dein vokul mahfaeraak ahst vaal! Ahrk fin norok paal graan fod nust hon zindro zaan, Dovahkiin, fah hin kogaan mu draal!
 

Ahrk fin Kel lost prodah, do ved viing ko fin krah, Tol fod zeymah win kein meyz fundein! Alduin, feyn do jun, kruziik vokun staadnau, Voth aan bahlok wah diivon fin lein!
 

Nuz aan sul, fent alok, fod fin vul dovah nok, Fen kos nahlot mahfaeraak ahrk ruz! Paaz Keizaal fen kos stin nol bein Alduin jot, Dovahkiin kos fin saviik do muz!
 

Dovahkiin, Dovahkiin, naal ok zin los vahriin, Wah dein vokul mahfaeraak ahst vaal! Ahrk fin norok paal graan fod nust hon zindro zaan Dovahkiin, fah hin kogaan mu draal!
 

just kidding. You may shout at someone and disintegrate them with your FUS RO DAH! Everyone will know that you're the Dragonborn though.

Messenger(Harlot) -- You have the most awesome job, which is............. Delivering letters! You will spend your nights delivering messages and letters n' shit. Careful, if you pick a dragon you will die. (They're not interested in hooman messages anyways). Also, beware of the Dark Brotherhood... And the vampires. Actually, if you deliver something to a vampire, you have a chance of knowing their role.
Miraak(Traitor!) -- For now, you team up with the rest of them. Once all dragons die, you will become one and continue the killing!
Dragon (Wolf) -- You are an ancient powerful being. Those mortals think they can rule over your land, steal your loot, and even steal your language! Kill them all with your fiery breath.
Greybeard(Seer) -- Your Voide have the power to show the true nature of people. Each night, you will use your Thu'um to have someone's role revealed to you. Don't let the dragons know who you are!
Peasant(Villager) -- You're just a random peasant. Live your days being slaughtered by dragons and killed by random Thu'ums.
Chicken(Tanner) -- Have you ever tried to hurt a chicken in a Skyrim village? Seriously, don't try it. Also, if you get lynched, you win automatically. Pretty easy, huh?
Lucia, the orphan(wild child) -- Choose a player to adopt you. If they die, you will offer your soul to Alduin, and become a dragon yourself!
Klimmek(Beholder) -- You help the greybeards. You use to bring them food and supplies, so you will know who the true Greybeard is. That's pretty much it.

Greybeards Apprentice(apprentice seer) -- As an apprentice, you learn the way of the Voice since young. If the Greybeard dies, you will become the new Greybeard, and Klimmek(the beholder) will know your true identity too..

Vampire(cultist) -- You are a Vampire! Once a normal human, you now are an immortal being that can, every night, choose a player to turn them into a vampire too! If all remaining living players at the end are vampires, they win. Watch out for the Dawnguard!

Dawnguard Agent(Cultist Hunter) - The vampires think they can rule Skyrim. It is your job to stop them. Every night, you may choose a player to visit and see if they are a vampire(Off course they will die if they are). If the vampires try to convert you, you will survive and kill the youngest vampire.
Dusk draws near, everyone gather to decide who they are burning this evening... Everyone now has {0} seconds to vote!
{0} seconds remaining to choose someone to die!
Pitchforks and torches ready, the mob has {0} seconds to choose someone to burn!
Now you have just {0} seconds to vote! Who's dying today?
The night has passed. The day will last {0} seconds so use it wisely...
The terrors of the night are now silenced. The city comes back to life, and you have {0} seconds until this round ends.
Another day begins. It will last {0} seconds, use this time wisely.
Night has fallen. Everyone fear about the dragons. The inns begin their service, and there are rumors of vampires on the loose. Night players: you have {0} seconds use your actions!
Another night begins. The snow falls again, and the night players now will have {0} seconds to act.
It is night now. This cold, dark period will last for {0} seconds.
The villagers have cast their votes.\n{0} tries to sneak out, and someone sees it. As they try to stop {0},a sword is drawn, a fight begins and at the end; {0} is dead. {1}

Suddenly, a stranger comes in.
The stranger raises his sword and shouts {0}'s name, accusing them of helping the dragons.
"This is a lie!" {0} claims, but no one listens.
The mob dismembers {0}, mercilessly. {1}
{0} is the name. {0} doesn't even try to fight. {1}

Suddenly, somebody shows up saying that a dragon is coming.\nEverybody rushes to the main street, but there is nothing there.\nThey even forget the lynching... It was actually a tie, but no one was there to count.

A man starts counting the votes, but the counting is interrupted by a loud cry.\nSomeone shouts "Kill! Kill the vampire!"\nThe mob searches for the creature, but night comes and they decide to head back to their own houses.
The peasants couldn't reach consensus, so you all postpone the lynching.
Before anyone votes, a waitress comes around with free beer for everyone. Everyone gets drunk and forget to vote!
T'was a cold day. No one ventured outside their homes, so no one voted.
I haven't created a pack full of funny lines just for you to forget the lynching phase!

Everyone gather in the morning, but no one sees {0}.\nA dragon is seen flying in the distance. When you follow it, you find {0}'s body burned down to the bones.\nDelphine used to snoop about, bot is now dead; maybe the Dragons are working with the Talmor?

In the middle of the night, you all see {0}, A.K.A. Delphine, running to the town's gate to fight a dragon.
The fight lasts until dawn. Delphine ask you all for help, but you're too scared to move. The dragon hits {0} with its tail, breaking all her ribs instantly. Delphine crumbles, and the dragon burns her with its breath.
Delphine is dead.
While you all prepare for {0}'s burial, the Dragon flies away. No more snooping days.

Morning comes, and there's a bloody battle axe sitting in the middle of the street. Just a little further, there is a burned boot with a leg still wearing it.\nSigns of fire and burned clothes shows that Lydia has been killed by a dragon last night. Poor {0}...

Someone screams in an alley. The villagers follow the voice just to see Lydia being carried away by a dragon. The dragon then drops {0} from the sky. {0} accept their death, and face it bravely. Lydia is dead.
An Unrelenting Force shout is heard. The dragonborn seems to be in trouble! {0} tries to fight off the dragons, but the shouts are all on cooldown! Your Dragonborn is now dead.

As you are all beginning your daily activities, a dragon suddenly shows up!\nAs the Dragonborn, {0} automatically charge into battle. The battle is fierce, but the Dragonborn is just a mortal. Soon {0} forces end, and the dragon prevails. Your Dragonborn is dead, and the dragons just had a tasty meal.
Everyone awake in the morning, to find the burned down remains of {0}. Only the gray beard is seen still attached to {0}'s face. Your have lost your Greybeard.
It seems that even {0}'s powers weren't enough to stop a dragon! {0} is found completely burned down. Your Greybeard is dead.

Dragons once again approach, and everybody hear {0} mumbling in a strange language.\nIn the middle of the main street, Sam Guevene is transforming himself into... A DAEDRIC PRINCE?\nHe is totally surrounded by dragons, and then suddenly creates a huge portal that sucks himself and the dragons into it. The good old Sam is certainly dead.

Good old Sam Guevene is nowhere to be found.\nWhen you ask the tavern owner about it, he says that Sam was actually the Daedric Prince {0}. The stranger says that {0} sucked themselves AND the dragons into a portal during a fight. {0} is dead, sure, but the dragons will be away for some time, at least.

As the sun rises above the village, the villagers find the burned corpse of {0}, dressed in strange clothes. The remains of a lute are also there. He died claiming that he was a Greybeard, but {0} was only a foolish minstrel. How sad...

{0}, the Minstrel, sang too much about the Dragonborn. The Dragons didn't like it! {0} is found dead in an alley, with clear signs of a dragon attack. {0} died believing they were a Greybeard, but no one feels sorry for him.
The dragons wanted a quick snack! {0} was in the menu. {0} is dead, but no one finds the body. {1}
It seemed a quiet night for {0}, but that changed fast. The dragons attacked {0} during the night! They easily torn {0} apart, and his/her death comes very quickly.\n{1}

Suddenly, {0} comes running to the city square, crying in pain.\n{0} crumbles to the ground, an arrow deep in their chest.\n{0} slowly turns into dust, and everybody knows that they were a vampire. This is clearly the Dawnguard's handywork! One less vampire to care about.

There are sounds of fight coming from {0}'s house. In the next morning, there's an official Dawnguard sign in front of their house saying that {0} was a vampire and now has been... "Properly taken care of"
No one died last night! Everyone feels safer, and it almost seems as the peace has been achieved at last.
No one died last night. It seems that everyone is afraid from arrows in knees. Even the dragons!
You don't know if it has been centuries, ages or only days. Right beside you, there are other dragons. You now live once again!
You once again feel the power through your bones. You rise from your grave, thanking your fellow dragons. You are alive now.
The other dragons are: {0}
You head to where {0} was buried. The bones are still there, so you all use your magic to revive them. Another dragon joins the fray.
You head to where {0} is. All you find is an old burial site. So you all carefully revive your fellow dragon. Skyrim shall feel {0}'s fiery breath once again!
Luck was not at your side. You have been found by a Dragon! Caught by surprise, you couldn't resist... You died.
No amount of body armor is enough to protect someone from the full rage of a dragon. You are outnumbered and outpowered, and died quickly in the dragon's claws.
I feel sorry for you, I really do. But the dragons, don't. They use you as their midnight snack.
The dragons ate you! Yes, they also have to eat. At least you were tasty.
The last thing you remember is fire. The dragons burned you. You died, how pitiful.
Say goodbye to your life, the dragons found you.
Oh no! {0} was more that it seemed to. You find yourself trapped in a strange dimension, and need to fight the dimension's creator in order to escape.
You attacked one of the most powerful beings you've ever seen. {0} traps you in a strange dimension. It'll take some time before you can go back to yours.
You tried to follow and help a dragon! The dragon killed you, because it had too much pride to accept help from a lower being like you.
Dragons have no use for lower beings like you. Since you tried to help one of them, you became a snack.
You try to follow {0}, but you found them almost dead! Together you fought the threat off. You should be proud, you have saved {0}'s life!
No matter what they say about you, you are a life saver. You prevented {0} from being killed!
Gods bless you! When you went to meet {0}, they were fighting the dragons all this time! You join the fight and you two fend them off.
The conversation with {0} was pleasing, it was a good night. You head back home with a bellyful of good mead.
As you show up to {0}'s house, they offer you some food and wine. You both spend the night among stories and music.
You went to guard {0}, but nothing interesting actually happened, so you head back home after a while.
You went to {0}'s house, but they weren't home!
Looks like there was a feast somewhere, and you weren't invited. {0} weren't home, so you head back to wherever you came from.
You went to meet {0}, but they were nowhere to be found.
You have been attacked, and would have died if Lydia weren't by your side. You should thank her!
You hear strange sounds. When investigating, someone(or something) attacks you! Lydia arrives just in time to stop you from being murdered. That was close. Too close.
The messenger tried to do their job, but visited a Dragon in the process! {0} won't be delivering any more messages from now on.
There's a burned body down the street. The smell of burned paper and ink doesn't leave any doubts. {0}, the messenger, has been killed by the dragons.
You try to find {0}, but they don't seem to be anywhere. You head back to your lair without killing anyone tonight.
Where is {0}? You fly as high as you can but is unable to find them. You enjoy the fresh air of the night before returning to your lair.
Sometimes you'd better go after someone that is surely at home. {0} wasn't and that means you'll sleep hungry tonight.
You had only one last message to deliver. You approach {0} just to discover that they are a Dragon. You try to run but it's too late, you are dead.
There's an urgent message for {0}. Unfortunately, {0} is a dragon, and kills you before you can react.
{0} tried to deliver a message to the wrong address! {0}'s remains are found burned down in some street.
The letters are taking too long. When you go after {0}, you only find blood and bones. Letters and messages are scattered everywhere, the messenger is dead!
{0}, the Messenger had ONE job: avoid dragons. The burned remains clearly show that they went straight into a dragon trap. Pathetic or pitiful?
{0} had a letter to deliver to {1}. When {0} gets there, they find a dragon attacking {1}! The dragon quickly turns on {0} and opens their mouth... {0} is dead.
{0} had a letter to deliver to {1}. Everything in order, {0} starts heading back home. A dragon appears and attacks {1}! {0} is also caught in the fire breath and dies instantly.

{0} had a letter to deliver to {1}. {1} was just minding their own business.\nThe dragons, however, were also minding theirs. They arrive at the perfect time that the Messenger and {1} were together, and the result is a Double Kill for the dragons.
You deliver {0}'s letter and head back home for they day, no dragons on sight.
You deliver {0}'s letter, the last of the day. You don't see any dragons, which is a good thing.

Finally a peaceful night. You deliver letters, the dragons are nowhere to be found, the weather is good and your letter bag is now empty, {0}'s being the last one to be delivered. Tomorrow is a new day, though!

You hear someone calling your name. It's the messenger with a letter. They say goodbye and leave, and you head back reading the letter: "COME JOIN THE DAWNGUARD AND HELP US STOPPING THE VAMPIRE THREAT."

You hear someone calling your name. It's the messenger with a letter. They say goodbye and leave, and you head back reading the letter. It says: "... WE KNOW." with a hand drawn below. You don't know what it means, but you keep it anyway.
The messenger approaches you, says he has a letter to give you. You open it, and it is an invitation for some kind of art being shown somewhere.
{0} is asking too many questions around the village. You figure out that they must be Delphine!
You see {0} talking about the dragonborn and the Blades. They must be Delphine!
The rumors say that {0} is {1}.
Someone tells you that {0} is {1}. You verify that the information is true.
Your investigation skills are perfectly precise! You learn that {0} is actually {1}
Looks like {0} didn't like the letter.\n A *FUS RO DAH* later and {1} is dead.
Looks like {1} as too inconvenient, so {0} tries to scare them off just for fun, but {0} was too weak! {1} is dead.\n Cause of death: a weak *FUS*...
The Dragonborn does not want to visit any art gallery! {0} shouts at {1}, sending the Messenger flying away.
*FUS RO DAH!*\n {0} is seen shouting to {1}. {1} hits a wall and breaks their neck with the strong impact. {2}
*FUS RO DAH!*\n {0} is seen shouting to {1}. {1} goes flying over the city's walls, and falls with their head in a rock, blood and brains everywhere. {2}
*FUS RO DAH!*\n {0} shouts, and {1} is seen being completely disintegrated by the shout.\n{2}
The Dragon has won!
All hail the almighty dragon!
The dragons' dawn is near! The dragon wins!
The dragons have won!
NO Imperials, NO stormcloaks! The dragons will rule Skyrim now.
The cold climate of Skyrim will become melting hot under the dragons' fiery breaths,
The villagers have won!
The villagers have won! Thanks to the nine divines.
The last threat is eliminated! The villagers finally can sleep at night.
Oh no! You lynched the Chicken! Every NPC grabs a sword and lunges toward you. They are too many, so you all lose.
Oh no! You lynched the Chicken! Every NPC grabs a sword and lunges toward you. The Chicken wins!
When you turn against the Chicken, all guards and NPCs charge at you.\nYou should consider better before lynching someone!
Remaining living players, roles, and team:
{0} has voted to turn {1}
{0} was sent to do your dirty work, and turn {1}... however, they were a Dawnguard! {0} is dead!
{0} couldn't turn {1} into a vampire, for {1} had superior training in... KILLING VAMPIRES. {0} is dead!

{0} had ONE job: turning the next player into a vampire, while avoiding {1}. What did they do? Went STRAIGHT into a trap.\nThey thought they were stronger than the Dawnguard, but the vampire dust sitting on the ground tells a clear message about the winner of that fight.
{0} came to your house last night, ready to turn you into a vampire.... but you shoved your silver sword right through their chest! A dragon is dead... {1} remain!
{0} tried to use their foul tricks with you. It's a shame that you didn't fell for them! You quickly slay another vampire. It leaves only their {1} friend(s).

You were walking down the street and found a beautiful person, crying on the ground. You try to help them, just to discover that they are a vampire! You have been turned into one as well. Every other night, you will have a chance to turn another player into a vampire.

You enter your house just to find a beautiful person crying in a corner. You try to help them, just to discover that they are a vampire! You have been turned into one as well. Every other night, you will have a chance to turn another player into a vampire.
Vampires: {0}
{0} has been turned into a vampire!
There is a new vampire among you, and their name is {0}!
{0} was sent to do your dirty work, and turn {1} into a vampire... but no one was home!
{1} weren't home, so {0} returns to the vampires' mansion with nothing but hunger.
All the dragons have died, and the only ones left standing have all been turned into vampires!\nThey won!
No one saw that coming. The vampires now rule over Skyrim!

Your role is simple - try to survive. Each day, you will have a chance to lynch someone. Choose wisely!

You are the Greybeard. In this role, each night, you may choose a player, and have their role revealed to you. Admit to your role wisely: If you reveal you are the seer, the wolves will try to kill you!

You get to have fun! Each day, you will attempt to deceive your fellow players. However, each night, you will get to pick a player to kill! Note:if you attack Sam Guevene, you yourself will become drunk, and will be unable to attack the next night as you sleep off your hangover! If you attack the Dead Dragon, they will become a DRAGON like yourself! Hooray friends!

As the Messenger, you will be given the chance to deliver messages to another player each night. If they are not evil, you will be told so (because you live!). If you visit a dragon etc., you will be killed. If you visit the player the dragons have chosen to kill, you will be killed as well. However - If you are visiting a player, and the dragons choose to kill you, you will survive since you weren't home. But fear for the Dark Brotherhood. They can kill you anywhere.

You drunken bastard! As the Sam, you are still just a villager. BUT! If the dragons kill you, they will become disabled for the next night, since you are secretly a Daedric prince and will fight them in your own dimension(but die anyway).
As the cursed, you are a normal villager... until the dragons kill you. Then you discover you were actually a dragon, and will have new teammates.
You are a traitorous bastard. Miraak will take the place of the dragons if they all die. You can then kill everyone else!
You are Lydia! Each night, you may choose a player to watch over. Be careful however - if you choose to watch over a dragon, there is a 50% chance you will be killed.
Each day, you will have the chance to investigate another player. Use this carefully however, for these is a 40% chance the dragons - and the Thalmor - will detect you!

You are the dragonborn! But, you're still a newbie dragonborn. You can shout once a day only two times, and then every single one of your skill (which are: shouting) will be on permanent cooldown. And remember: you can't fast travel when enemies are nearby.
The chicken's goal is simple: Get Lynched. If the Chicken gets lynched, everyone else gets chased by a furious mob and loses.

The minstrel Thinks they have a strong voice, but the only think you can do is to sing the dragonborn song and hope you can guess their roles right. You honestly believe you are a Greybeard though, but even Malukah sings better than you. (She actually sings MAJESTICALLY)

As a vampire, it is your goal to convert all other players (except dragons and of course, the Dark Brotherhood) to your covenant. If at the end of the game, all living players are vampires - you can rule the land!
Your job is to hunt the vampires. If the vampires attack you, their newest member will die. Each night you may pick a player to 'hunt' - if they are a vampire, they will die.
At the beginning of the game, you will choose someone adopt you. If they die, you will be transformed into a dragon. Don't ask why, it's how magic works.
For now, you are a normal peasant. However, if the Greybeard dies, you will become the new Greybeard, because the world NEEDS the Greybeards.

A Companion's job is simple (I don't think being a mercenary is simple, but...)- they automatically know who the other companions are. Otherwise, they are a simple villager. And oh, you don't get to transform into a werewolf. Pretty sure it only happens in a different langpack ü§î

You mastered the face sculpting magic... You can pick a player at the start of the game. If that player dies, you will become what they were. Note: If the player was converted to vampire, you will take on their original role. All other normal rules apply: If they were Lucia and their parents died, you will become a dragon. Otherwise, you will inherit their parents. The vampires cannot transform you (but can after the you switches roles). Also - the Face Sculptor can NOT win unless they have transformed. If at the end of the game, you are still, well, you; you lose (exception: lover)

Love is in the air. As the priestess of Mara, you will choose two players at the start of the game. These two players will become madly in love! If one of them dies, the other will die of sorrow :(\nNote: Lovers will know who each other are, but not be told their roles. If the lovers are the last two alive, they win, regardless of teams. If the lovers are on different teams, and one team wins , the lover wins as well. TL;DR if at least one of the lovers was on the winning team, they both win together.

A mad, vindictive player. As the forsworn, you try to keep to yourself. However, when others come to visit you, they may find themselves dead, as your killing impulses are too strong. If the dragons attack you, you have a chance to take one of them with you. Otherwise, if you die, you will get a chance to shoot someone as you die. Note: For dragon attacks, the chance starts at 30%. If there is one dragon, you have a 30% chance to kill them (and survive). For each additional baddie, add 20% (2 dragons = 50%, 3 = 70%, etc). However - if there are multiple dragons, while you may kill one of them, you will still be outnumbered and killed. If the vampires try to convert you, they have a 50% chance to fail. If they fail, you have a 50% chance to kill one of them!

The Night Mother sent you here to wipe them all. You are a lone player, on your own team. The Dark Brotherhood can win only if they are the last player alive (exception: lovers). As a skilled and cold serial killer, you can kill ANYONE - dragons, dragonborns, vampires, chickens, whatever. If the dragons try to attack you, you will kill one of them (random), and live. OP, huh?
